required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Treatment of Wounds Using Oasis® ECM
clinical_study.official_title: Treatment of Wounds Using Oasis® Extracellular Matrix in the Community Setting

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this clinical study is to gather post-market clinical evidence on the use of Oasis ECM as a treatment for different types of chronic wounds in the community setting in the United Kingdom.

primary_outcome.description: To demonstrate the percentage of patients with wounds progressing to at least 50% healing

secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of patients with complete wound closure

secondary_outcome.measure: Wound closure- Mean number of weeks
secondary_outcome.description: mean number of weeks to complete wound closure

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient reported Quality of Life measurement
secondary_outcome.description: The Wound Quality of Life (QoL) questionnaire is used for measurement of Health-Related Quality of Life in patients with chronic wounds. The total value of this measurement is derived from an average of 17 questions; each question has a value of a minimum of 1 and a maximum of 5. The lower the score, the better the outcome. Subscales are not combined to compute a total score.

arm_group.description: Patients with chronic non-healing wounds with planned use of OASIS Extracellular Wound Matrix

intervention.description: Patients will receive OASIS Extracellular Matrix according to the Instruction for Use

study_pop.textblock: Patients with non-healing ulcer (any etiology) present for at least 1 month and treated in the ambulatory clinic or home healthcare setting

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Non-healing ulcer (any etiology) present for at least 1 month and treated in the ambulatory clinic or home healthcare setting
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Age < 18 years
2. Unable or unwilling to provide informed consent
3. Unable or unwilling to comply with the study follow-up schedule, and procedures
4. Simultaneously participating in another investigational drug or device study
5. Target wound area is < 2 cm2 or > 140 cm2 after baseline debridement
6. Target wound has reduced in area by > 40% with 4 weeks of documented standard of care therapy
7. Known allergy to pig or porcine products
8. Systemic infection
9. Infection of the target wound as determined by the collection of pus
10. Osteomyelitis
11. ABI/TBI < 0.6 obtained within 3 months prior to the screening visit
12. Other exclusions may apply
